jobs_results.title: Senior Android Engineer
jobs_results.description:
The Fabulous Company is looking for a Senior Android Developer who wants to see their code used by millions of people around the world. This is an opportunity to work on a fast-growing product with a large user base that is frequently among the Top 10 most downloaded Health and Fitness apps that makes real change in people's lives. Joining Fabulous means you‚Äôll be working in our senior level team of Android Developers and cooperating with an experienced CTO and an award-winning designer. We are a world-class Android team with a shared code between iOS and Android using J2OBJC. Kotlin is used in the day to day dev. Kotlin multiplatform is what we're going toward. We are a remote team with minimum meeting policy, trust, no daily standup, and remote since day 1 (founded 7 years ago).

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Applying your technical knowledge across all stages of feature development
‚Ä¢ Delivering high quality, modular and testable code, including business logic being shared with iOS app
‚Ä¢ Taking part in preparing relevant project documentation
‚Ä¢ Creating user interfaces based on mock-ups prepared by our UI/UX designers, including some neat animations
‚Ä¢ Taking part in improving of our processes and standards

Requirements
‚Ä¢ Deep Knowledge of Android Java and Kotlin. Kotlin is Fabulous‚Äô language.
‚Ä¢ Great understanding of clean architecture, design patterns, and clean code.
‚Ä¢ Experience developing, releasing and maintaining native Android applications.
‚Ä¢ Capacity to work efficiently as part of a team; able to give and receive feedback.
‚Ä¢ Capacity to write a succinct email and to communicate effectively in English.

Nice to have:
‚Ä¢ Any experience with Jetpack Compose
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of MVI pattern
‚Ä¢ iOS app development experience
‚Ä¢ Java Script basics (used for tooling

Benefits

About Us

An award-winning health, wellness, & coaching company that creates apps which fall the top ten internationally. Our science-based approach sits squarely in the tech-for-good lane, helping people live their best lives. Everyone who has joined this company is committed to using evidence-based research to find the absolute best ways to change lives for the better.

Our History

Three co-founders created the Fabulous app: Sami, Amine, and Taylor. Growing up in Tunisia, Sami and Amine were only 16 when they met. With their early iteration, they reached out to Taylor, an award-winning designer in Malaysia. Their vision was welcomed into an incubation lab for startups at Duke University led by world-renowned Behavioral Economics Professor Dan Ariely. Our Chief Storyteller Jaz co-founded the Introductory Psychology program at Stanford University.

Our Approach

We use a behavioral economics lens to help individuals find that 'on switch' inside them to achieve their fullest potential. What has emerged is a system that transforms tiny habits into profound long-term changes. A world in which people with ADHD thrive. A method for gratitude to reach through difficulty. A sanctuary to seek out your true purpose. A fountain of knowledge. A space for rest and self compassion.

Our Mission

Help every individual discover the wonderful person inside themselves by creating: beautiful, evidence-based, life-changing products.

Our Environment

The first thing that sets us apart is that we‚Äôre not a place at all. While we‚Äôre a remote company, it‚Äôs not unusual to feel you know your teammates better than those you‚Äôve shared an office with in the past. Ours is a professionally nourishing environment that is flexible and fully remote. Team members enjoy in house challenges and Slack event and work across a variety of tools. Meetings are kept to a minimum and deep work is encouraged.

Our Awards
‚Ä¢ Apple Best Apps of 2018
‚Ä¢ Editor‚Äôs app choice in more than 30 countries
‚Ä¢ Winner of Google‚Äôs Material Design Award
‚Ä¢ Best App Finalist in Google Play Awards
‚Ä¢ Consistently ranking in the top ten Health & Fitness apps
‚Ä¢ Backed by Facebook Startup Lab and Microsoft Venture

Our Norms

Ownership: Be the CEO of your tasks. No one is watching over your shoulder. Be the proof.

Open Communication: Constructive ideas are always flying across time zones.

Deep Work: Disconnect. Find your flow. Become industrious. It‚Äôs about the work here.

Always Offer Context: Sharing rationale works wonders in asynchronous conversations.

Impeccable Agreement: Promise, then follow through. Everyone relies on everyone.

Egos are checked at the door. Those who join our workforce place themselves in service of our members.

Our Values

#collaboration #craftsmanship #feedback #respect #responsibility #simplicity #speed

Our Future

To this day, over 30 million people have started their journey to better themselves with our apps. We are creating a generation of change-makers, with the same drive to help others, each in their own way.

Our Invitation

At Fabulous, every team member is a sculptor in their own right. Together, we help millions of users step out of their block of stone and step into the fullest version of their life through behavioral science. Tell us what drives you; if you were to pick up your tools, what would you contribution look like?

jobs_results.title: Android Embedded Developer
jobs_results.description:
Our client is a leading global smartphone brand. He is renowned for delivering innovative and high-quality mobile devices that cater to a wide range of consumers. With a strong commitment to cutting-edge technology and exceptional user experiences his products combine advanced features with stylish designs.

Join our dynamic team as an Onsite Project Engineer!

This exciting role is based at our customer's office in Paris, where you'll collaborate closely with clients to deliver top-notch solutions. Occasionally, you'll travel to user sites for short business trips to troubleshoot and debug issues, ensuring smooth and efficient operations.

What You Will Do (Tasks):
‚Ä¢ Stress Testing and Compatibility: Conduct recurring stress tests on Android mobile phones and fusion products, ensuring compatibility with local third-party applications.
‚Ä¢ Fault Analysis and Troubleshooting: Independently analyze fault logs reported by users, troubleshoot code based on log analysis, locate root causes, and provide solutions, either independently or with headquarters' assistance.
‚Ä¢ R&D Support: Assist the R&D department at headquarters by deploying problem analysis and locating tools, accumulating and building problem-locating capabilities.
‚Ä¢ User Site Visits: Travel to user sites when necessary to diagnose and resolve user issues.

Requirements (Qualifications):
‚Ä¢ Technical Skills: Proficient in Java and C/C++ programming languages; knowledgeable about Linux operating system and Android SDK.
‚Ä¢ Experience: At least 1-5 years of experience with Linux drivers, with preference for those with development experience in HDMI, LCD, touch, camera, USB, BT/WiFi/GPS, sensor, and power drivers.
‚Ä¢ Android Expertise: Familiar with Android driver debugging processes, systematic problem analysis, handling, and debugging; understanding of the Android platform, application, and framework development.
‚Ä¢ Debugging Tools: Proficient with Android debug tools such as ADB, Systrace, Serial toolset, and capable of analyzing Android logs.
‚Ä¢ Language Skills: Fluent in written and verbal English; excellent Chinese communication skills would be a plus.
‚Ä¢ Education: Bachelor's degree or above in Computer Science, Engineering, Communication, Electronics, Information Technology, or related fields.

Join us and contribute to the innovation and excellence that defines Honor. Be a part of a team that drives cutting-edge mobile technology and delivers exceptional user experiences.

jobs_results.title: Experienced Android Engineer
jobs_results.description:
Back Market is the world‚Äôs leading refurbished electronics marketplace with a team of 650 people, powering operations in 21 countries (and counting!).

Named one of the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company in 2019 and again in 2021, our mission is simple: empowering people to consume tech sustainably by offering folks a high quality, accessible, and more eco-friendly alternative to buying new electronics. Why? Refurbished tech helps lower our collective environmental impact. We have indeed contributed to avoid the production of more than 1,000,000‚ÄØtons of CO2e worldwide since our launch in 2014.

Be part of an exciting and growing international adventure that will change the way the world consumes tech.

Mobile Engineering at Back Market

Mobile engineers come from different cultures, backgrounds and working environments. They are spread across Europe (Spain, France, Germany). Each squad is composed of pairs of iOS & Android engineers, working on the native language to build the best experience for our users.

You will also collaborate with other product squads & stakeholders, along with the Mobile Core squad that is providing the foundations & infrastructure for your developer experience on apps. That‚Äôs why we are also in favor of having mobile engineers from product squads contributing to technical & core projects from time to time.

The role & responsibilities

We are looking for an Experienced Android Engineer to join one squad of our main tribe, Customer Journey. We have the mission in 2024 and beyond, to provide the best features, services & user experience for our app users.

The engineer will also contribute to the mobile engineering chapter, with talented iOS & Android engineers, showing exemplary professional collaboration with teammates and peers. Whether hooked on Kotlin, developing advanced and smooth UI & UX, or architecture scalable features, the engineer will share & remain open to new ideas.

What you will do :
‚Ä¢ Build & optimize Android code autonomously on any development task, delivering code on time and with a quality mindset.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in building native applications using Kotlin, with a strong foundation in architectural patterns (MVVM, MVP, etc.), coroutines, flows, and multi-modules architecture
‚Ä¢ Seeks understanding of how users interact with product/service to enhance the user experience, by collaborating with product design & product management on new features.
‚Ä¢ Writes engineering review proposals and contributes to technical design, thinking through failure cases.
‚Ä¢ High sense of collaboration by participating in code reviews, maintain high-standards code quality, including regular exchanges with the iOS team and the Mobile Core team.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to the migration to Jetpack Compose for the new & existing features
‚Ä¢ Prevent regressions and write Unit & UITests, maintain automated E2E testing funnels
‚Ä¢ Ability to monitor & debug effectively by diving into the root cause of production issues, clarifying requirements where necessary: product KPIs (Amplitude), logs (Datadog), and crash reporting (Firebase Crashlytics).
‚Ä¢ Participation in the tech community is appreciated: events, meetups, continuous learning through blog articles and industry conferences.
Recruitment process :

- Phone screen with St√©phane (1h)
- Technical screening with two Android engineers (~30 minutes)
- Android live technical interview exercise & discussion (~2h)
- Team fit with your future manager + one person from our product/platform engineering team (~1h)
- BM value interview with our leadership (~45m)

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US ?

- A meaningful job: you will help avoid thousands of tons of electronic waste and fight against planned obsolescence. It counts!
- A meaningful company: we became a mission-driven company in January 2022.
- Be part of a worldwide growing company based in Europe, the USA and Asia to face great challenges : you will have the freedom to innovate and adopt new ideas!
- Work alongside passionate experts: who will share their knowledge and help you develop and grow in your career.
- Grow your career: with a flexible career path and a dedicated Learning & Development team. Back Market will help you evolve with personalized internal trainings and external handpicked providers from day 1!
- Leadership Academy by Back Market:‚Äúbe a coach not a dictator‚Äù is at the core of this program ! We train and enable all our leaders to support their team towards achieving goals. Be a manager at Back Market is an unique experience we take by heart.
- An attractive salary, equity and a host of benefits including : Lunch voucher, health insurance, relocation package, paid time off for activism in your community, parental benefits, flexible hours, etc‚Ä¶
- One Loving Tribe: you will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, open-minded and friendly environment.
- Be part of one of our Employee Resource Groups createdaround shared identities, common backgrounds and/or special interests crafted to be a safe space and an expressive outlet.
- Several internal events: The Monday Brief (weekly)/ The Somehands (monthly)/ The All Hands (annual).
- We‚Äôre here to SABOTAGE: It‚Äôs our mantra. It keeps us focused on what we aspire to be: a little bit sneaky, always smart, kinda frugal and constantly conspiring to create maximum impact.

Back Market is an Equal Opportunity Employer which means we pledge to not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetic information.. If reasonable accommodations are needed for the interview process, please do not hesitate to discuss this with the Talent Acquisition Team.

Back Market is helping to address one of the biggest challenges of our time: climate change. We take this so seriously that we were awarded status as a ‚ÄúSoci√©t√© √† Mission‚Äù, or company with a social mission, by the French government. We know we can‚Äôt tackle a global problem without a globally representative team so we are committed to embedding diversity, equity and inclusion principles in every aspect of our organization. But more importantly, being One Loving & Free Spirited Tribe is in our DNA as it is one of the five foundational values of our company since we got started way back in 2014. We are committed to hiring and supporting diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We know our lofty goals cannot be reached unless everyone has a seat at the table along with the resources and opportunity to grow.

jobs_results.title: Mobile Software Engineer (Android) - Omnichannel Supply Team
jobs_results.description:
At Teads, we do quality and responsible advertising, at scale. We invented outstream video advertising and now have a reach of 1,9 billion unique users per month powered by an end-to-end proprietary platform. We foster a sustainable advertising and media ecosystem by funding quality journalism and respectfully connecting brands to consumers.

To innovate, we have created a strong company culture that empowers passionate people, gives them the right tools and trusts them to do their jobs as best they can. Teads roadmap is full of ambitious and strategic projects related to the evolution of our offering for both publishers and advertisers.

Teads has an engineering team that brings together 200+ talented individuals in 3 main locations (Montpellier, Paris, and Bucharest). We are organized in agile and autonomous feature teams and share technical knowledge within several communities of practice.

We promote diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment to enable all employees to feel valued and respected, which fosters creativity and innovation by allowing constructive collaboration and open exchange of ideas.

Our organization offers the opportunity for hybrid work, allowing for two days in the office and the option to work remotely for the remainder of the week. Additionally, we provide relocation packages for those who prefer to relocate to one of our engineering offices.
üëâ Join a team of passionate people who build quality and responsible advertising, at scale!

Our Omnichannel Supply Team
The mission of the Omnichannel Supply Team is to develop and maintain different integration methods between the top publishers worldwide and our platform, which comprises leveraging our proprietary ad player and SDK, as well as third-party sources.

This enables our advertisers to benefit from an all-in-one omnichannel solution that spans across a diverse range of mediums such as the web, mobile applications, connected TVs, and other emerging channels that enable them to reach wider audiences in order to maximize their brand exposure and increase the effectiveness of their marketing campaigns.
Our main Engineering challenges at Teads
‚Ä¢ Working in a very high-traffic environment (1.9 billion users per month, 100 billion events per day) with low latency and high availability constraints (2 million requests per second, responses in less than 150 milliseconds).
‚Ä¢ Rich and diverse tech stack and system architecture to optimize for performance, scalability, resiliency, and cost efficiency. We use mostly Scala and TypeScript, among others.
‚Ä¢ Management of large datasets with milliseconds order of magnitude access time, to compute in a near real-time complex auction resolution algorithm (18 million predictions per second).
‚Ä¢ Build efficient and easy-to-use web products used by thousands of users working for the world's most premium publishers, advertisers, and agencies.
‚Ä¢ A fast-changing environment where we continuously collaborate with Product teams constantly for new features and Products.
‚Ä¢ Bring a wide diversity of profiles to the same level of quality and knowledge.

What will you do?
As a Mobile Software Engineer with a background on Android, you will also have some specific challenges:

‚Ä¢ Quality and robustness as a pillar. Working on a SDK adds inertia between release and app integration. We have developed a robust and well-tested code to limit the bad impact of this inertia.
‚Ä¢ Have a good understanding of native applications. Our SDK is a mix between native and TypeScript code (20%-80%) allowing developers to use a full native interface but allowing us to share a core engine between the iOS & Android SDKs.
‚Ä¢ Being able to adapt our process and our technology to face proprietary store evolution (IDFA less, new store restrictions, new architecture requirement, etc.).

Your missions will be to:‚Ä¢ Develop our SDK in native language using Kotlin.
‚Ä¢ Support and contribute to our core engine using TypeScript.
‚Ä¢ Work with other members of the engineering team on other products of the platform to sustain our SDK.

What will you bring to the team
‚Ä¢ Good programming abilities. Testing your development is second nature to you, and you are very mindful about your application architecture, performance and maintainability and its overall quality.
‚Ä¢ Strong problem solving skills.
‚Ä¢ Working collaboratively with the team, able to explain your decision and share your knowledge.
‚Ä¢ A strong knowledge of Swift or Kotlin language on mobile application development.
‚Ä¢ Having experience in deploying apps to reach a broad audience is essential.
‚Ä¢ Open minded to cross-platform development, collaborating across both iOS and Android platforms.

Bonus points:

‚Ä¢ Experience with MySQL or SQL in general.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge in backend development in the Java environment.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of React development.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of the Scala language.
‚Ä¢ In the absence of backend knowledge, a willingness to learn and develop skills in this area is appreciated.
‚Ä¢ Participate and/or animate with the developer community: blog post, conference, meetup, etc.
Why work at Teads?At Teads, Product and Engineering work hand in hand and are aligned towards the same goal: to scale our business while continuing to create new and exciting products.

‚Ä¢ We value team spirit, pragmatism, listening and we encourage initiatives.
‚Ä¢ We promote end-to-end development: ‚ÄúYou build it, you run it, you monitor it‚Äù.
‚Ä¢ We share knowledge and support with each other beyond any organizational boundary.
‚Ä¢ We fix issues during a blameless postmortem and learn from it so that it doesn‚Äôt happen twice.
‚Ä¢ We are working together to create great engineering, but we are also supportive to promote a great work-life balance.

We care about you:‚Ä¢ Security & Savings: Attractive package providing financial peace of mind, including competitive compensation, profit-sharing, daily meal vouchers (Swile), family health insurance (Alan), and a personalized relocation package (if needed).
‚Ä¢ Career Development: Continuous investment in our employees' skills: in-house and external training, tech conference opportunities, internal mobility (individual contributor or management career ladder).
‚Ä¢ Life Balance: A well-balanced work-life for our employees is one of our top priorities: 35+ days off per year, hybrid work (2-3 days remote work per week, more is open to discussion), fully covered parental leave, and reserved daycare places.
‚Ä¢ Wellness: Prioritizing employee well-being through premium work equipment, enjoyable work environment (work-life balance, team building events, summits), remote work subsidy, promoting Diversity & Inclusion with internal & external initiatives (women speaking groups, dedicated school partnerships), dedicated charitable time and sustainability actions (Eco Tree, subsidy for eco-mobility).

Discover more about our culture and benefits on our Engineering website.
What are our recruitment process steps?

We want to get to know you and we try to give you the insight you need to make an informed decision to join us. For that, you can find all the information in our Engineering hiring process article!
About Teads
Teads operates a leading, cloud-based, omnichannel platform that enables programmatic digital advertising across a global ecosystem of quality digital media.

As an end-to-end solution, Teads‚Äô modular platform allows partners to leverage buy-side, sell-side, creative, data and AI optimization technologies. For advertisers and their agencies, Teads offers a single access point to buy the inventory of many of the world‚Äôs best publishers and content providers.

Through exclusive global media partnerships, Teads enables advertisers and agencies to reach billions of unique monthly users in brand safe, responsible advertising environments, while improving the effectiveness and efficiency of digital ad transactions.

Teads partners with the leading marketers, agencies and publishers through a team of 1,200+ people in 50 offices across more than 30 countries.

We're committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, and represents employees across a variety of skill sets. We embrace contributions from all ages, sexes, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations and gender identities.

#LI-Hybrid

jobs_results.title: LEAD DEVELOPER ANDROID (H/F)
jobs_results.description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: France

Description de l'entreprise

Notre expertise ? Accompagner nos clients √† capter l‚Äôattention de l‚Äôutilisateur et transformer cette interaction furtive en une interaction m√©morable. C‚Äôest dans cette optique que nous accompagnons les entreprises dans la mise en ≈ìuvre, et le pilotage de dispositifs digitaux pour une exp√©rience utilisateur r√©invent√©e.‚Äã

La juste interaction, c‚Äôest quoi ? C‚Äôest capter notre attention au bon moment, au bon endroit et la convertir en envie et en confiance. Un √©quilibre subtil entre le trop et le trop peu. Entre le trop t√¥t et le trop tard.‚Äã

Devenez SQLien et faites partie de cette grande aventure au sein d‚Äôune soci√©t√© √† taille humaine, mais avec de grandes ambitions. Nous sommes plus de 2200 talents sur plus de 13 pays et 3 continents.‚Äã

Tes missions :
‚Ä¢ D√©velopper des applications Android.
‚Ä¢ D√©cider des orientations techniques sur les solutions propos√©es √† nos clients.

Selon tes affinit√©s, et en compl√©ment du d√©veloppement natif, tu pourras travailler sur des applications cross plateformes (React native, Flutter).

Qualifications

Ce que nous attendons de toi :

Informations compl√©mentaires

Informations suppl√©mentaires

Quel salaire pour ce poste ? On en parlera de mani√®re transparente avec toi au moment de notre premier √©change. Ce n‚Äôest juste pas tr√®s simple d‚Äôen parler ici avant d'avoir eu un premier √©change ;)

Mais tu dois avoir une fourchette ? Oui, bien √©videmment, mais nous souhaitons vraiment faire correspondre la ma√Ætrise d'une comp√©tence avec le bon salaire. Nous sommes flexibles sur ce point et voulons √©viter que le salaire soit une raison pour laquelle un(e) candidat(e) ne postulerait pas chez nous.

Ton futur √©cosyst√®me :
‚Ä¢ Une Mobile Factory de plus de 60 passionn√©s en France.
‚Ä¢ Des projets digitaux pour des clients grands comptes (notamment dans les secteurs des services financiers, de l'industrie, de l'√©nergie, des grandes marques de luxe et du retail).
‚Ä¢ Tu deviendras un membre √† part enti√®re de notre ¬´ TechSociety ¬ª - Rassemblement et partage de toutes nos communaut√©s techniques.
‚Ä¢ Des workshops et ateliers techniques pour favoriser le partage de connaissances.
‚Ä¢ Des Managers de carri√®re pour √™tre suivi par l'un de tes pairs.
‚Ä¢ Un accompagnement dans l‚Äôexpression de tes talents (certifications, formations, d√©veloppement de partenariats avec les √©diteurs, publications dans la presse, participation aux √©v√®nements, salons, conf√©rences techniques...).
‚Ä¢ 1 √† 3 jours de t√©l√©travail par semaine.

Des questions sur vos donn√©es personnelles ? Retrouvez notre politique de confidentialit√© concernant les candidats : https://www.sqli.com/sites/default/files/2024-01/SQLI-PRIV-Politique-Confidentialite-Candidats-C0-29012024.pdf

jobs_results.title: Confirmed Android Engineer
jobs_results.description:
About BlaBlaCar

BlaBlaCar is the world‚Äôs leading community-based travel app enabling 27 million members a year to carpool or travel by bus in 21 countries. Our team of 800 employees counts over 50 nationalities and is spread across our 5 global offices, 30% working fully remotely.

Your Mission

We are looking for a Confirmed Android Engineer to join our Post-booking full-stack squad at BlaBlaCar. Within the squad, you'll work on building and fine-tuning top-quality features which enable our passengers to enjoy a smooth and serene post-purchase experience, from real-time bus tracking to seamless ticket exchange ; our ultimate objective being to elevate our customers‚Äô satisfaction and loyalty.

As a Confirmed Android Engineer, you‚Äôll work collaboratively with your squad mates and your stakeholders on the design and the delivery of these product features from the early-stage conception to the final roll-out. Beyond the actual implementation, you'll be empowered to own and impact each phase of our projects' lifecycle.

You will be reporting to Alexandre, Engineering Manager of the squad, and will join a full-stack squad composed with 6 engineers, supported by a Product Manager and an UX Designer. You will also be part of the transversal Android chapter composed of the 11 Android Engineers dedicated to BlaBlaCar's mobile application.
Your Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with non-technical stakeholders to help shape the features that land in production
‚Ä¢ Design, architect and develop Post-Booking features for the BlaBlaCar application
‚Ä¢ Be responsible for the quality of the Android application, and contribute to improving it
‚Ä¢ Share your knowledge in the team: provide documentation on your work, enforce good practices and processes, communicate on changes
‚Ä¢ Conduct code reviews
Your skills and qualifications
‚Ä¢ 3+ years experience building Android apps with a strong engineering culture
‚Ä¢ Experience with MVVM architecture and clean architecture
‚Ä¢ Experience working on RESTful API, Dagger, Retrofit, Kotlin, Kotlin coroutines, unit and integration tests
‚Ä¢ You're comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with a strong product focus, you appropriately set the needle between technical quality and time-to-market
‚Ä¢ You have good communication skills, you enjoy sharing & learning from others, you‚Äôre able to adapt your communication to non-technical stakeholders
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôre a team player, willing to positively tweak and improve our team‚Äôs ways of working, favoring team communication and agreements over theoretical or dogmatic approaches
‚Ä¢ You embrace change, are able to take a step back, and focus on added-value tasks
‚Ä¢ You have a results-driven and product-oriented mindset
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôre fluent in English

If you don‚Äôt meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you‚Äôd still be a great fit for this role in your application!

What we have to offer
‚Ä¢ Full remote possible in the country of the role (+ access to BlaBlaCar co-working spaces in Bordeaux, Toulouse, Lyon, Nantes and Sophia Antipolis)
‚Ä¢ 4 additional weeks parental leave 100% paid
‚Ä¢ Financial support for home office equipment
‚Ä¢ Relocation package and visa support
‚Ä¢ Free unlimited carpooling & bus rides
‚Ä¢ Employee Stock Ownership plan
‚Ä¢ 25 days holiday per year + RTT
‚Ä¢ Local meal plan policies (Swile card in France)
‚Ä¢ 50% transportation paid in France (Forfait Mobilit√© Durable)
‚Ä¢ Mental health support through Moka.care
Interested in joining the ride?
‚Ä¢ a 45-min video-call with Chlo√©, Talent Acquisition Manager, to get to know you, understand your career expectations and answer your questions
‚Ä¢ a 60-min video-call with Alexandre, Engineering Manager, to discuss your experience and share more details about the team
‚Ä¢ a 60-min design case with Software Engineers, going deeper into your technical skills in problem solving
‚Ä¢ a 60-min Live coding / Pair programming with Software Engineers
‚Ä¢ a 60-min Code review with Software Engineers
‚Ä¢ a 30-min video-call with Gilles, VP Engineering, for vision fit and rounding off the process

Our hiring process lasts on average 25-30 days, offers usually come within 48 hours. Not sure yet? Check out our 100 reasons to join BlaBlaCar!

BlaBlaCar is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. If you don‚Äôt meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you‚Äôd still be a great fit for this role in your application.

jobs_results.description: Job Description: Pr√™t √† vous d√©ployer ? ‚ú® Alors bienvenue chez Rakuten France ! A vous : - le projet exaltant - le mouvement et les perspectives - le plaisir de se lever le matin - le management qui fait grandir - l‚Äôenvergure et la taille humaine Si vous vous retrouvez dans nos piliers, rejoignez l‚Äô√©quipe Apps au poste d'Android Developer ! A propos de l‚Äô√©quipe Tech: Notre √©quipe de D√©veloppement a pour but d‚Äôimpl√©menter les nouvelles fonctionnalit√©s de notre site web, sa version mobile ainsi que ses applications mobiles en m√™lant du d√©veloppement Backend et Frontend. Elle met un point d‚Äôhonneur √† la technicit√© et au partage de connaissances : nos ing√©nieurs travaillent ensemble et communiquent leurs id√©es via des conf√©rences techniques internes et sujets transverses. L‚Äô√©quipe est organis√©e autour de 12 features teams (2 tribes) qui ont chacune un domaine de l‚Äôapplication, et qui sont toutes constitu√©es d‚Äôun Lead Tech, de D√©veloppeurs, d‚Äôun Product Owner et d‚Äôun QA, qui constituent le tri-amigos. A propos de la Feature Team Apps : L'√©quipe Apps, charg√©e du d√©veloppement des applications natives iOS et Android de Rakuten France, fonctionne en m√©thode agile SCRUM. Elle est constitu√©e d'une Product Owner, d'un Lead Technique, d'une Lead D√©veloppeuse Android, des D√©veloppeurs et de deux QA. De plus, vous ferez partie d'une √©quipe technique globale forte de nombreuses comp√©tences, qui se challenge et partage ses connaissances, assiste √† des conf√©rences techniques internes et sujets transverses. L'√©quipe Apps propose √† nos utilisateurs mobiles la majeure partie des features de notre marketplace, telles que les annonces, la recherche, la partie checkout (passage en caisse, m√©thodes de paiement‚Ä¶), ce qui est relatif √† notre club de fid√©lit√©, la mise en ligne d'annonces et bien d'autres ! Vos missions : √ätre impliqu√©(e) sur toutes les phases des projets, de la conception √† la production ; Participer √† la conception technique des projets et proposer des technos pour les d√©veloppements ; Contribuer aux estimations des projets pour construire la roadmap, et aider le Product Owner √† construire une roadmap r√©aliste ; D√©velopper les stories prioris√©es avec un niveau de qualit√© avanc√© (TU / TI / BDD) ; √ätre garant de la qualit√© du code : participer aux tests et √† la documentation des projets, et avoir √† c≈ìur que les nouvelles features ravissent nos utilisateur(trice)s ; Aimer √™tre en qu√™te de nouveaut√©s et am√©liorations techniques. Cette veille r√©guli√®re permettra de briller pendant nos TechWeeks ; Echanger avec les autres √©quipes de d√©veloppement afin d‚Äôapporter une exp√©rience utilisateur homog√®ne entre les diff√©rentes plateformes. Votre profil : De formation ing√©nieur Bac+5 ayant une solide exp√©rience en d√©veloppement Android (3 ans minimum). √ätre proactif(ve) et curieux(se) et aimer les technologies innovantes que vous √©tudierez et analyserez au cours de TechWeeks et lors de conventions comme les Android Makers. Aimer discuter avec les pair(e)s, et aimer √©galement √™tre incollable sur les nouvelles technos et pratiques tendances. L‚Äôanglais sera √©galement tr√®s utile pour la documentation et les pull requests. √ätre autonome tout en sachant travailler en √©quipe, organis√©(e) Environnement technique : Framework Android Kotlin / RxJava & Coroutines / Flow API Restfull BDD Room Patterns : MVVM / Repository Git (Github / Gitflow) / Jira / Firebase Int√©gration Continue (Github Actions) M√©thodologie : Agiles / Scrum / Kanban Serait un plus : Clean Archi Jetpack Compose Les Avantages de Rakuten Une politique de t√©l√©travail flexible, incluant une participation annuelle De superbes bureaux au c≈ìur de Paris (Sentier) Une carte Edenred √† utiliser pour le d√©jeuner La prise en charge des frais de transport √† 50% La mutuelle prise en charge √† 50% par Rakuten 12 RTT annuels, en plus des 25 jours de cong√©s Des moments de convivialit√© organis√©s toute l‚Äôann√©e Programme avantageux de stock-options Rakuten Group Des √©quipes multiculturelles & internationales Si vous vous reconnaissez dans ces diff√©rents points et que vous avez envie de rejoindre des √©quipes motiv√©es, talentueuses & bienveillantes alors vous √™tes la bonne personne, c‚Äôest pour vous l‚Äôoccasion de participer √† l‚Äô√©volution d‚Äôune marketplace qui met au c≈ìur de sa strat√©gie ses marchands et ses membres. Process de recrutement Echange avec C√©line, Talent Acquisition Manager Test technique Rencontre avec Pauline, Lead Dev Android et Lionel, Tech Lead IOS Rencontre avec l'√©quipe Apps : Sid-Ali, QA et Lucas, Product Owner Rakuten France recrute, reconnait et int√®gre tous les Talents. Rakuten est un leader mondial des services en ligne et l‚Äôinventeur du mod√®le de place de march√© B2B2C. Fond√© en 1997 au Japon, Rakuten propose un √©cosyst√®me de plus de 80 services digitaux compl√©mentaires, disponibles dans 30 pays, dans des domaines aussi vari√©s que l‚Äôe-commerce, les t√©l√©communications, les Fintech, la publicit√© ou encore l‚ÄôIntelligence Artificielle. En France, Rakuten est le pionner de l‚Äô√©conomie collaborative et circulaire. Sa plateforme inclusive permet aux grandes enseignes comme aux TPE/PME locales de commercialiser leurs produits √† une tr√®s large communaut√© d‚Äôacheteurs et de b√©n√©ficier d‚Äôoutils technologiques et de services innovants pour d√©velopper leur activit√©, en ligne comme en magasins, via le click & collect notamment. L‚Äôengagement de Rakuten en faveur d‚Äôun e-commerce vertueux se traduit aussi par son approche non concurrentielle, qui encourage les commer√ßants comme les particuliers √† revendre leurs produits, faisant de la plateforme un acteur majeur de la seconde main. La r√©ussite de Rakuten repose ainsi sur une double promesse : le pouvoir d‚Äôacheter et de revendre. Aujourd‚Äôhui, plus de 10 millions de Fran√ßais profitent de cet engagement via le Club R. Plus qu‚Äôun programme de fid√©lit√©, le Club R r√©compense acheteurs et vendeurs et favorise le d√©veloppement de l‚Äô√©conomie circulaire. Fid√®le √† ses valeurs fondatrices, Rakuten pr√¥ne un mod√®le de digitalisation responsable, pour les commer√ßants, pour l‚Äôenvironnement et pour le consommateur : un e-commerce qui met tout le monde d‚Äôaccord. Rakuten is a world leader in online services and the inventor of the B2B2C marketplace model. Founded in 1997 in Japan, Rakuten offers an ecosystem of over 80 complementary digital services available in 30 countries in areas as varied as online shopping, telecoms, fintech, advertising and artificial intelligence. In France, Rakuten is the pioneer of the collaborative and circular economy. Its inclusive platform enables everyone from major industrial companies to small local businesses to sell their products to a very wide community of buyers, benefiting from innovative technological tools and services to develop their business online and in store through click & collect in particular. Rakuten‚Äôs commitment to virtuous online shopping is also evident in its non-competitive approach which encourages retailers and individuals to resell their products, making the platform a key player in the second-hand sector. Rakuten‚Äôs success is founded on a two-fold promise: the power to buy and the power to resell. Today, over 10 million French people benefit from this commitment through Club R. More than a loyalty programme, Club R rewards buyers and sellers and helps the circular economy develop. Faithful to its founding values, Rakuten advocates a responsible digital model for retailers, for the environment and for the consumer: online shopping approved by everyone.
